content: In Greek mythology, what substance was said to flow in the veins of the gods instead of blood?

In Greek mythology, the gods were believed to have ichor flowing through their veins instead of blood. Ichor is described as a golden, ethereal fluid that is associated with divine life and immortality. It was thought to be the essence that sustained the gods and gave them their supernatural abilities and longevity. The concept of ichor highlights the fundamental differences between the divine and mortal realms in ancient Greek beliefs.
